techmeme.title: Alphabet winds down agriculture startup Mineral, which became an independent subsidiary in 2023, and is licensing some of its tech to berry producer Driscoll's (Julia Love/Bloomberg)
WIPO: between 2014 and 2023, 54K generative AI patents were filed, 25% of which were filed in 2023; China leads with 38K+ patents, followed by the US with 6,276 (Emma Farge/Reuters)
Reddit users: Netflix is following through on its plan to phase out its cheapest $11.99/month ad-free tier, instead pushing its $6.99, $15.49, and $22.99 tiers (Emma Roth/The Verge)
CDK Global, a software provider to ~15K North American car dealerships, says "substantially all" of its dealers are back online, after two cyberattacks in June (Charles Gorrivan/Bloomberg)
Proton launches Docs in Proton Drive, a privacy-focused alternate to Google Docs, after acquiring secure note-taking app Standard Notes in April 2024 (Natasha Lomas/TechCrunch)
